about.title: About us
about.text: BotOlympics is an annual robotics competition bringing teams, students and enthusiasts together to learn and compete. Each edition features multiple challenges, workshops and community events. This site is maintained to make it easy to update per edition.

challenges.title: Challenges
challenges.text: Discover more about the different tournaments and register!

items.name: PROVA ISR
items.subtitle: Elementary level
items.description: Teams program a simple autonomous robot to follow lines and complete tasks.

items.name: BOT'N ROLL
items.subtitle: Secondary level
items.description: Timed navigation and payload delivery challenge using Arduino based robots.

items.name: FCTUC CHALLENGE
items.subtitle: University level
items.description: Advanced autonomous navigation and sensing challenge for university teams.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule shows all talks, workshops and competition times. Download or view the schedule image below.

items.a: Use the registration links in each challenge box or visit the main registration form.
Each challenge lists the intended educational level (elementary, secondary, university).

items.q: Can I form a team on-site?
items.a: Yes — individuals can register and we will help find teammates where possible.
